div.p: Greetings. I am sending to you the letters of Lord Cognetius. He writes back to me about the business of Pontassella; I have recommended him to the legate among the Rhaetians as a person of better reputation. I hope we will achieve something; for he has promised me generously and kindly regarding his willingness. I write this while busy; you will excuse the negligence of the letter. It is written from Germany that Johann Friedrich of Saxony, who is besieged at Gotha, endures the siege with a strong and present spirit and is prepared for anything. The Germans neglect the Turkish war, I do not know how wisely. The Spaniard has his hands full in the Netherlands; for it is reported that the younger Nassau, brother of Orange, has arrived with great forces and German cavalry to aid the Belgians.
To the most honorable and reverend men, Lords Heinrich Bullinger and Rudolf Gwalther, pastors of the Church of Zurich.
